name: UFC Jumbled Quiz | Sports Other | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the first man to hold two Pride titles in two separate weight classes at the same time?
questions.explanation:
Dan Henderson.

	He held both the Middleweight and Welterweight belt at the same time in 2005.

questions.text: Who was the first man to win in both a Pride tournament and a UFC tournament?
questions.explanation:
Mark Coleman.

	Mark Coleman won UFC 10 and 11, and also won the PRIDE 2000 Openweight Grand Prix. He was also the first UFC Heavyweight Champion.

questions.text: Anderson Silva has never been defeated.
questions.explanation:
false.

	He has lost many times. He lost to Yushin Okami due to an illegal kick to a ground opponent. He also lost to ChonanRyo Chonan by submission (flying scissor heel hook), Daiju Takase by submission (triangle choke), Luiz Azeredo by split decision, and others.

questions.text: Which of these set a record for the fastest MMA knockout?
questions.correct: Chris "The Menace" Clements vs Lautaro Tucas
questions.explanation:
Chris "The Menace" Clements vs Lautaro Tucas.

	Their fight only lasted 3 seconds in TKO 35.

questions.text: Brock Lesnar faced Frank Mir in his UFC debut and lost.  What submission did Frank Mir use to defeat him?
questions.explanation:
Kneebar.

	Brock Lesnar debuted at UFC 81 against Frank Mir.  Lesnar dominated the fight until Mir caught him in a kneebar.

questions.text: UFC 4, Revenge of the Warriors, took place in December 1994.  Returning fighters included former two-time UFC Champion Royce Gracie, UFC 3 and defending champion Steve Jennum, and UFC 3 competitor Keith Hackney. One other returning fighter made it as far as an alternate match, but lost to Joe Charles. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Kevin Rosier.

	Rosier made it to the semi-finals of UFC 1, eventually losing to Gerard Gordeau. He was submitted by Joe Charles in just 14 seconds, making his second UFC appearance a very brief one. Ken Shamrock was invited back for his third tournament, but he fought in a 2 day tournament in Japan the week before. Shamrock won the tournament and became the "King of Pancrase".

questions.text: What are the two nicknames that Georges St. Pierre was most commonly known by?
questions.explanation:
GSP,  Rush.

	GSP lived in Saint-Isidore, Quebec, Canada. However, he fought out of Montreal.

questions.text: What was the outcome of Lesnar's match against Shane Carwin at UFC 116?
questions.explanation:
Lesnar won by submission.

	Brock Lesnar faced Shane Carwin at UFC 116. Carwin rocked Lesnar in the early seconds of the first round. It looked like Carwin was going to win, but Lesnar was defending himself and escaped the round. In the early seconds of the second round, Lesnar took down Carwin and choked him out.

questions.text: The first match of UFC 4 in 1994 welcomed Royce Gracie back to the octagon after his forfeiture against Harold Howard in UFC 3. Gracie took on Ron Van Clief, a legitimate grand master of Chinese Goju-Karate who held a 10th degree black belt in the discipline. However, Gracie's submission skills were too much, as he caused Van Clief to tap out to which submission hold?
questions.explanation:
Rear Naked Choke.

	Gracie took Van Clief down almost immediately after catching a kick, and bided his time on the ground with short punches. Gracie finally unleashed some hard punches and elbows to cause Van Clief to turn over, and Gracie was able to sink in the rear naked choke for the win. Van Clief set a UFC record by being the oldest competitor at 51 years old.

questions.text: Who did Brock Lesnar defeat to win his first UFC Heavyweight Championship?
questions.explanation:
Randy Couture.

	Brock Lesnar defeated Randy Couture at UFC 91 by TKO to win his first UFC Heavyweight Championship.
